sn4.21:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling among the Sakyans at Silāvatī.
sn4.21:1.3: Now on that occasion a number of bhikkhus were dwelling not far from the Blessed One—diligent, ardent, and resolute.
sn4.21:1.4: Then Māra the Evil One manifested himself in the form of a brahmin, with a large matted topknot, clad in an antelope hide, old, crooked like a roof bracket, wheezing, holding a staff of udumbara wood. He approached those bhikkhus  and said to them:
sn4.21:1.5: “You, sirs, have gone forth while young, lads with black hair, endowed with the blessing of youth, in the prime of life, without having dallied with sensual pleasures.
sn4.21:1.7: do not abandon what is directly visible in order to pursue what takes time. ”
sn4.21:1.8: “We have not abandoned what is directly visible, brahmin, in order to pursue what takes time.
sn4.21:1.9: We have abandoned what takes time in order to pursue what is directly visible.
sn4.21:1.10: For the Blessed One, brahmin, has stated that sensual pleasures are time-consuming, full of suffering, full of despair, and the danger in them is still greater,
sn4.21:1.11: while this Dhamma is directly visible, immediate, inviting one to come and see, applicable, to be personally experienced by the wise. ”
sn4.21:1.12: When this was said, Māra the Evil One shook his head, lolled his tongue, knit his brow into three furrows, and departed leaning on his staff.
sn4.21:2.1: Then those bhikkhus approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and reported everything in full.
sn4.21:3.2: That was Māra the Evil One, who had come in order to confound you. ”
sn4.21:3.3: Then the Blessed One, having understood the meaning of this, on that occasion recited this verse:
sn4.21:4.1: Who has seen the source whence suffering springs,
sn4.21:4.2: “How could that person incline to sensual pleasures?
sn4.21:4.3: Having known acquisition as a tie in the world,
sn4.21:4.4: A person should train for its removal. ”
